result.execSummary:
The defendant Randall G. Buckingham was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
1:32 p.m. Defendant Randall G. Buckingham in court, in custody, with attorney Richard John Shawl. Michael William Schiek, DA, appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 14CM329, 15CM353, 15CF283, 15CM117, 15CM33. Plea questionnaire & waiver filed in 15CF283. Shawl/Schiek cases resolved. In 15CF283, State moves to dismiss Cts. 3 & 4; granted by the Court. Defendant pleads no contest to Cts. 2 & 3 as repeater. Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea; waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty of Cts. 1 & 2 in 15CF283. Court and counsel in receipt of revocation summary. Schiek statement to sentencing; victim impact compliance. Shawl statement to sentencing. Court statement.  The court informs defendant of right to request expungement of the DNA under Wis. Stat.  165.77(4). 15CF283/15CM353 - court costs due 9/12/16 at 3:00 p.m. to Clerk's office/may apply for payment plan upon release from jail. 2:13 p.m. adj. 

Court sentence - 15CF283 - Cts. 1 & 2
WHS
2 yrs. POP consecutive to revocation cases 14CM329/15CM33/15CM117
CC/CV/Supervision fees on each count
DNA surcharge remitted on Ct. 2
DNA sample
$803.48 restitution plus $80.34 (10%)
Appeal rights given on all cases

15CM117
7 mos. county jail/concurrent
Huber
72 days' credit
Unpaid costs; judgment entered

15CM33
3 mos. county jail/concurrent
Unpaid costs; judgment entered
3/14/16 - added 72 days' credit/bjb

14CM329
7 mos. county jail/concurrent
Huber
108 days' credit
Upaid costs; judgment entered
Review hearing scheduled for September 12, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

State moves to dismiss counts 1 and 3 in case 15cm117 - Granted.  Defendant pleads no contest to 15cm33 and count 2 in case 15cm117.  Plea questionnaire filed.    Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty.  State files Victim Impact Statement.  Michlig/Hogan/Court statement to sentencing. 
Court Sentencing - Concurrent
WHS/POP 12 months
